mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Comments that he is recovering from a headache but expects to join George Washington, himself recovering from an illness, for a sailing party of three or four days; discusses the controversy about and vote on Congress's move to Philadelphia; Rhode Island "at length acceded to the Union"; comments on Congress authorizing the President to borrow money.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Washington, George, 1732-1799
Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1790 June 6, New York, [New York] to [William] Short, n.p.
